title: Louisville joins recycling effort in partnership with Coca-Cola and Kroger
text:
In an effort to boost recycling rates, Louisville Metro Government, in partnership with Coca-Cola and Kroger, is joining the Coca-Cola Recycle & Win program – a sustainability initiative that offers tips on recycling and rewards selected residents for proper recycling with a $50 Kroger gift card.
“Our Sustain Louisville plan includes a goal of diverting 90 percent of recyclable material away from our landfill by the year 2042,” said Louisville Mayor Greg Fischer. “We believe the Coca-Cola Recycle & Win program will help us make progress toward that goal.”
The Coca-Cola Co. and Coca-Cola Bottling Co. Consolidated have invested more than $150,000 in the recycling program, which includes a direct mail educational packet to be sent to all single-family households in Metro Louisville the week of Oct. 16.
THE COURIER-JOURNAL
Louisville gets sustainability recognition
The educational packet will contain an official “Give It Back” sticker, along with images highlighting which materials should go in the recycling container.
Residents must place the “Give It Back” sticker on one of their recycling containers to be eligible for a chance to win a $50 Kroger gift card. Additional packets and stickers will be available at Kroger stores throughout Louisville.
Representatives of a "recycling patrol" will begin visiting area residences later this month, in an effort to “catch” households that are recycling properly. A total of 270 of those households will receive $50 Kroger gift cards over the next six months.
